justification: "The drift‐diffusion model (DDM) is one of the most widely used computational models ... to quantify the evidence accumulation processes during decision-making".

measured_by: drift rate parameter (v) of the DDM
justification: "The drift rate (v) is the average speed of evidence accumulation toward a decision".

measured_by: decision boundary parameter (a) of the DDM
justification: "The decision boundary (a) is the distance between two decision thresholds... it represents the speed-accuracy trade-off".

measured_by: initial bias parameter (z) of the DDM
justification: "The initial bias (z) reflects the starting point of evidence accumulation".

measured_by: non-decision time parameter (t) of the DDM
justification: "Non-decision time (t) is the time not used for evidence accumulation, e.g., stimulus encoding or motor execution".

topic_or_construct: trial-to-trial variability in evidence accumulation speed
justification: "Drift Rate variability (sv): The variability in the drift rate parameter across trials".
"Initial bias variability (sz): The across-trial variability in the starting point parameter in the DDM".
"Non-decision time variability (st): The across trial variability in the non-decision time parameter in the DDM".
